action.action-desc: Mr. Gosar introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To suspend payroll taxes for 2021 and 2022.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pandemic Payroll Tax Suspension Act.

section.header: Suspension of payroll taxes for 2021 and 2022

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law—

paragraph.text: with respect to any taxable year which begins in the payroll tax suspension period, the rates of tax under section 1401 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 shall be 0 percent,

with respect to remuneration received for pay periods ending during the payroll tax suspension period, the rates of tax under 3101 of such Code shall be 0 percent (including for purposes of determining the applicable percentage under sections 3201(a) and 3211(a) of such Code), and

with respect to remuneration paid for pay periods ending during the payroll tax suspension period, the rates of tax under section 3111 of such Code shall be 0 percent (including for purposes of determining the applicable percentage under section 3221(a) of such Code).

subsection.text: The term payroll tax suspension period means the period beginning on January 1, 2021, and ending on December 31, 2022.
The Secretary of the Treasury shall notify employers of the payroll tax suspension period in any manner the Secretary deems appropriate.

paragraph.header: Transfers to Federal old-age and survivors insurance trust fund
paragraph.text: There are hereby appropriated to the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund established under section 201 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 401) and the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund established under section 1817(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395i(a)) amounts equal to the reduction in revenues to the Treasury by reason of the application of subsection (a). Amounts appropriated by the preceding sentence shall be transferred from the general fund at such times and in such manner as to replicate to the extent possible the transfers which would have occurred to each such Trust Fund had subsection (a) not been enacted.

paragraph.header: Transfers to social security equivalent benefit account
paragraph.text: There are hereby appropriated to the Social Security Equivalent Benefit Account established under section 15A(a) of the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 (45 U.S.C. 231n–1(a)) amounts equal to the reduction in revenues to the Treasury by reason of the application of subsection (a). Amounts appropriated by the preceding sentence shall be transferred from the general fund at such times and in such manner as to replicate to the extent possible the transfers which would have occurred to such Account had subsection (a) not been enacted.

For purposes of applying any provision of Federal law other than the provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, the rates of tax in effect under section 3101 of such Code shall be determined without regard to the reduction in such rate under this section.
